pat-2026-01-31-001.name: Document What Exists, Don't Invent Patterns
pat-2026-01-31-001.pattern: NEVER create standardized patterns - ONLY document what actually exists in the codebase
pat-2026-01-31-001.problem: Created 'standardized border pattern' that contradicted actual codebase, causing green borders on panels when codebase never uses them

workflow: 1. Use grep -r to find ALL occurrences of the pattern
2. Read 5+ different files that use the pattern
3. Note what is consistent AND what varies
4. Document the actual patterns that exist
5. Note when each pattern is used
anti_patterns: ❌ Don't: See different approaches and create a 'standard' that changes them
❌ Don't: Apply pattern based on 1-2 examples
❌ Don't: Change code to match documentation
✅ Do: Document what exists with notes on when each applies

quality_rules: Before documenting any UI pattern: grep -r 'borderColor' src/components/*.tsx
Must read 5+ files before claiming a 'pattern'
If files show different patterns: document all of them with notes on usage
Documentation describes code, code doesn't follow documentation
evolution_markers: This pattern created after failure where I invented border patterns instead of documenting them
Multiple user corrections required to fix the issue

pat-2026-01-31-002.name: Two Distinct Border Patterns in TUI
pat-2026-01-31-002.pattern: TUI uses two different border patterns: (1) Panels/containers always have static borders with colors.border or colors.primary, (2) Only tiny interactive elements inside use conditional borders with green when focused
pat-2026-01-31-002.problem: I tried to create a unified 'standardized pattern' that broke this distinction

pattern_1_panels.rule: Always has border, static color (dim or cyan), NEVER conditional on focus

pattern_2_buttons.usage: Tiny buttons, interactive elements INSIDE panels
examples: SyncPortalParts.tsx - pause/resume buttons, speed selector buttons
pattern_2_buttons.rule: Conditional border, green when focused, transparent when unfocused

quality_rules: BUTTONS: border={conditional on isFocused} borderColor={conditional: green|transparent}
NEVER use pattern_2 on panels - only on tiny elements inside
Check 5+ examples before claiming a pattern

pat-2026-01-31-003.name: Documentation Authority Hierarchy
pat-2026-01-31-003.pattern: Code is authoritative, documentation is secondary. When documentation contradicts code, the documentation is wrong and must be fixed.
pat-2026-01-31-003.problem: I followed my patterns.md documentation even when it contradicted the actual codebase. User kept correcting me but I kept following my wrong docs.

hierarchy: 3. When they conflict, fix documentation NOT code
solution.workflow: When implementing: check code first, update docs after

quality_rules: If patterns.md says X but codebase does Y: patterns.md is wrong
Always grep -r to verify patterns before applying
Documentation is for learning, not for dictating

pat-2026-01-31-004.name: Invoke Self-Improvement Agent for Learning
pat-2026-01-31-004.pattern: When user mentions learning, self-improvement, or says 'you should learn from this', invoke the self-improving-agent skill immediately - don't manually update files
pat-2026-01-31-004.problem: User said 'you are self learning you have a self learnng skill it amazes me you fail to leverage it'. I had manually updated patterns.md and workflow.md instead of using the skill designed for this purpose.

solution.trigger: User mentions: self-improvement, learning from experience, 'you should learn', 'don't do that again', or indicates a fundamental process failure
solution.action: Invoke Skill tool with self-improving-agent skill
solution.why: The skill provides automated extraction, memory consolidation, episodic logging, semantic pattern abstraction - manual updates miss all of this

quality_rules: If user says 'learn from this': use self-improving-agent skill
If user says 'update instructions': use self-improving-agent skill
If user points out process failure: use self-improving-agent skill
Manual updates are OK only if they're trivial (typo fixes)
